ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Class envy
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It would be logical for Class to just be a number, in the database. But to be words when input instead of numbers that are oh so easy to mess up.
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 12 Apr 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:

>Maybe they just don't like us? I would guess it should have been Bd and not
>Mk, what monk ever uses a shield? Sounds like another of the incredibly
>common typographical error. You can bet class is just a number they assign,
>which means that its really easy to input the wrong class number since it
>doesn't jump out at you like a meaningful entry would.

It would be logical for Class to just be a number, in the
database. But to be words when input instead of numbers
that are oh so easy to mess up.

===================================================
Sarah sarah@...
===================================================
My picture of the world is of masses of people extending gifts to other
people, doing favors -- but nobody keeping score. -- Dr. Whitsett
===================================================
